title: 15 Easy 5-Ingredient Slow-Cooker Recipes for Basically Every Occasion
description: These slow cooker recipes for chicken, meatballs, potatoes, pudding, and everything in between call for just five ingredients or less.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE 15 Easy 5-Ingredient Slow-Cooker Recipes for Basically Every Occasion Add these simple recipes to your rotation. By Stacey Ballis Stacey Ballis Stacey Ballis is a novelist, cookbook author, food and lifestyle journalist, and recipe developer who specializes in culinary fiction, and empowering home cooks to create extraordinary cooking and dining experiences for themselves and their loved ones. Allrecipes' editorial guidelines Published on December 7, 2024 Close Slow cooking shouldn't be fussy. By its nature, slow cooking is meant to take a load of work off you so that you can make a delicious, filling dinner for your family or a party. While some recipes require more than a dozen ingredients—and they may very well be worth the effort—the beauty of slow cooking is that even just a handful of ingredients can lend themselves to savory, comforting results. In short, there's something to be said for going back to basics and keeping things easier. We've gathered some of our favorite slow cooker recipes that call for five ingredients or less. These recipes often use pantry ingredients, along with slow-cooking staples, so they'll come together quickly. These recipes couldn't be easier! 01 of 15 Big Game Dip pelicangal Speaking of tailgating, a hot cheesy dip is a natural addition to any game-day menu. Using your slow cooker to prep this recipe couldn't be easier. View Recipe Save 02 of 15 Easy, Two-Ingredient Pulled Pork mauigirl If you're serving your family or a crowd, pulled pork is an ideal choice. All you need (besides this super-simple recipe) are buns and some side dishes to make the perfect pulled pork dinner. No need to break a sweat. View Recipe Save 03 of 15 Slow Cooker 3-Ingredient French Dips Jeremy French dip sandwiches may seem like too much fuss to attempt. This recipe, however, takes the hassle out of making the classic sandwich so that it's easy enough to prep on a weekday. View Recipe Save 04 of 15 So Simple Beef Stroganoff Casey's Kitchen Beef stroganoff is a classic dinner for a reason. This hearty dish only needs some rice or noodles to make a meal that will delight your family. This version takes the hassle out of the stew without sacrificing flavor. View Recipe Save Our 10 Best Slow Cooker Pasta Recipes 05 of 15 Slow Cooker Hawaiian Chicken D B Mattoon Chicken can get a bit bland and boring, but this spunky recipe will wake up your family's palates. Serve over rice with steamed vegetables for an easy and delicious dinner. View Recipe Save 06 of 15 Slow Cooker Chicken and Salsa Buckwheat Queen Prefer something a bit spicier? The combination of tender chicken and salsa (any salsa!) will hit the spot. Whether your family craves mild or fiery meals, they will enjoy this dish. View Recipe Save 07 of 15 Mother's Pot Roast Delly If you crave the comfort of your mother's pot roast, you can find it in this five-ingredient recipe. "The best vegetable gravy you ever tasted—and the roast isn't bad either," writes Allrecipes member J.Stewart. "We always had this meal with mounds of mashed potatoes. Great on a cold wintry evening!" View Recipe Save 08 of 15 Slow Cooker Baby Back Ribs Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Don't sweat standing over a smoker or grill for hours. Let your slow cooker do the work of tenderizing racks of ribs for your next barbecue. "These are the best I've had, short of the actual grilling method of course," says Allrecipes member Norah. "This is a very simple recipe that I came up with a few years ago. It's not rocket science, just ribs cooked in the slow cooker and finished in the oven." View Recipe Save 13 Summer Slow Cooker Dinners That Won't Heat Up Your Kitchen 09 of 15 Slow Cooker Green Beans and Potatoes dotdash meredith food studios When you're using your slow cooker for complete meals or entrees, you can forget how great it is for side dishes. This combo of potatoes and green beans would make an ideal accompaniment for juicy roasted chicken, hearty meatloaf, or any other protein you have in the oven. View Recipe Save 10 of 15 Pinto Beans Muy Facil Buckwheat Queen Full of protein and fiber, beans aren't just a nutritional powerhouse but also delicious. This recipe for jalapeño and garlic pinto beans will get these legumes on your table with ease! View Recipe Save 11 of 15 Crock-Pot Mushrooms Soup Loving Nicole Nothing pairs with steak or pork chops like buttery mushrooms. This version lets your slow cooker do all the work while you man the grill. View Recipe Save 12 of 15 Slow Cooker Cider Applesauce (No Sugar Added) Rock_lobster Applesauce is a staple for many, but even no-added-sugar versions can still contain preservatives. Plus, nothing tastes better than fresh applesauce. This simple slow-cooker recipe will help you keep the good stuff in stock at your house, while giving you total control over ingredients. View Recipe Save 13 of 15 Alexander's Chocolate-Covered Peanuts Christine Melting chocolate to make candy may seem daunting, as it requires double boilers and a lot of attention to ensure it doesn't scorch or seize. Your slow cooker and a few pantry ingredients are all you need for these delicious confections, which make a great hostess gift or addition to a dessert buffet. View Recipe Save 14 of 15 Slow Cooker Vanilla Tapioca Pudding lutzflcat Your slow cooker is a perfect vehicle for all sorts of desserts, like this five-ingredient vanilla tapioca pudding. Best of all, it takes just five minutes of prep time! View Recipe Save Our Entire Collection of Slow Cooker Desserts 15 of 15 Crock Pot Party Meatballs Nicholio Slow cookers are an entertaining godsend. These perfect party meatballs stew in your slow cooker and will keep warm without keeping a flame on. "This is my most requested party recipe," says Allrecipes member fabeveryday. "People go crazy for these slow cooker party meatballs, and there is never a single one leftover at the end of a party or tailgate."
